physical_examinations.vital_signs: Weight below the 3rd percentile, Length below the 3rd percentile, Head circumference at the 25th percentile
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Acral and periorificial erythematous plaques with overlying desquamation. Sparing of the head, upper back, and skin folds. Lab abnormalities include: total protein 4.3 g/dL, albumin 1.5 g/dL, hemoglobin 8.6 g/dL, AST 366 U/L, ALT 190 U/L, GGT 151 U/L, WBC 19.7 x 10^9/L.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The skin eruption worsened over time, beginning as an erythematous eruption with desquamation and evolving to severe lesions with associated edema, anemia, and hypoproteinemia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythematous eruption with overlying desquamation in acral and perioral distributions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eruption persisted and worsened despite treatment with oral zinc.
